greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest factor of the n-th Fermat number F(n) = 2^(2^n) + 1.
comment: a(14) might need to be corrected if F(14) turns out to have a smaller factor than 116928085873074369829035993834596371340386703423373313. F(20) is composite, but no explicit factor is known. - _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Feb 11 2010
link: Wilfrid Keller, Prime factors k·2^n + 1 of Fermat numbers F_m and complete factoring status
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fermat Number
formula: a(n) = A007117(n)*2^(n+2) + 1 for n >= 2. - _Jianing Song_, Mar 02 2021
example: So 3 as the 0th entry and 641 is the 5th term.
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Mar 27 2004
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 02 2008 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_
a(16)-a(19) added based on terms of A007117 by _Jianing Song_, Mar 02 2021
